summary:
This mod dramatically increases the worth of silverware, some dwarven items, gems, and jewellery.
NO LONGER SUPPORTED
descriptionHtml:
this mod is no longer supported; if anyone wants to take this somewhere, they are more than welcome to!


The fearless Dovakhiin at last reached the end of the dungeon, having faced down thousands of before-thought-indestructable undead. His enemies all slain, he reached a treasure troveof precious gems. Holding aloft one of the glittering gems, the Dovakhiin said; "Meh, why not?"

sound familiar? 

This mod dramatically increases the worth of silverware, some dwarven items, gems, and jewellery. They are now (mostly)all upwards of 100 septims. If it sounds overpowered and unrealistic ... it probably is, but I find it much more immersive to have a silver ring cost more than two apple pies. Given the sheer amount of jewellery in-game, this can be majorly overpowering. I use several mods that change money and merchantile, and so far I haven't run into any conflicts. If you find any, please let me know!

Obviously, this works best with a mod that increases merchants' gold. There are several on the nexus; I use RivvqPL's Golden Vendors, which is possibly the least immersive one, but still very good for my game at least. 
this is my first time uploading a mod so any tips or constructive criticism would be greatly appreciated! 

edit; I've recently started playing with Skyre, and it is compatible to a point; it changes the silverware back to the default. however, for me the whole point of this mod was to change the gems etc, so that's more or less ok ... also, I guess you could make the argument that the silverware is in fact painted pottery, or something. anyway, if this is too much of a problem, I will figure out how to make a patch for it.
